pair.Prompt: In United States v. Joint Traffic Association (1898), what was the argument of Mr. Carter for the Joint Traffic Association?
pair.Response: Response: Mr. Carter argued that the Anti-Trust Act prohibited all contracts in restraint of trade or commerce, regardless of whether the rates were reasonable or unreasonable. He also argued that the authority of the Government to maintain the suit was sustained in United States v. Freight Association, 166 U.S. 290, 343, citing in re Debs, 158 U.S. 564 and Cincinnati, New Orleans, &c. Railway v. Interstate Commerce Commission, 162 U.S. 181; Texas & Pacifto Railway v. Interstate Commerce Commission, 162 U.S. 197.
